dialog.english: Ryan! Look who's here?
Good to see you. What a small world.
Long time no see. How have you been?
I'm doing great. You haven't changed a bit.
dialog.korean: 잘 지내고 있어. 넌 하나도 안 변했구나.

dialog.english: Nice talking to you. Say hello to your wife.
Catch you later. I will keep in touch.
Can't complain. Same as usual.
dialog.korean: 그럭 저럭 지냈어. 늘 똑같지 뭐.

dialog.english: Really? You have changed a lot.
I got something for your birthday.
A present for me? You shouldn't have!
It's cold outside. I'll give you a ride home.
dialog.korean: 바깥 날씨가 추워. 내가 집까지 태워 줄께.

dialog.english: Don't bother, but thanks anyway.
dialog.korean: 일부러 그럴 거 없어. 어쨌든 고마워.

dialog.english: Don't mention it. That's what friends are for.
dialog.korean: 별말을 다 하네. 친구 좋다는 게 뭐야.

dialog.english: Something smells fishy. Just be yourself.
What's the weather gonna be like this Saturday?
dialog.korean: 이번 주 토요일 날씨가 어떨 것 같아?

dialog.english: The weather reporter said that it was gonna be raining.
I get the feeling that we should call off our trip.
dialog.korean: 여행을 취소해야 할 것 같은 느낌이 들어.

dialog.english: Boy! It totally slipped my mind.
Don't tell me that you're going to go alone behind my back.
dialog.korean: 설마 나 몰래 혼자 가려고 했던 건 아니겠지.

dialog.english: No way! I'll just go with the flow.
dialog.korean: 말도 안 돼. 난 그냥 대세를 따를 뿐이야.

dialog.english: What's the rookie like?
Outgoing. He likes to hang out with people.
Don't tell me you have changed your mind.
No. Don't jump to conclusion.
I feel like going out with you tonight.
dialog.korean: 오늘 밤에 너랑 놀러 가고 싶어.

dialog.english: I'm sorry, but I have a previous engagement.
Nothing beats beer with chicken on a hot day.
dialog.korean: 이렇게 더운 날 치맥보다 나은게 없지.

dialog.english: Come to think of it, I can't miss a drinking session.
dialog.korean: 생각해 보니, 내가 술자리를 놓치면 안 되지.

dialog.english: That's it! You might as well cancel your appointment.
dialog.korean: 바로 그러야! 너 약속 취소하는 게 낫겠다.

dialog.english: I'm gonna have to postpone it for another day.
I feel like crying my eyes out.
dialog.korean: 눈이 붓도록 펑펑 울고 싶은 기분이야.

dialog.english: Chin up and I'll keep you company.
We have to wait for an hour for the next bus.
dialog.korean: 다음 버스를 타려면 한 시간을 기다려야 해요.

dialog.english: We might as well walk. It only takes 20 minutes on foot.
Could you postpone it for another day?
It's up to you. It's all the same.
How did you get those plane tickets?
I pulled some strings. I have good connections.
dialog.korean: 내가 백을 좀 썼지. 좋은 인맥이 좀 있거든.

dialog.english: I knew it. Care for some coffee after lunch?
dialog.korean: 그럴 줄 알았어. 점심 먹고 커피 한잔 어때?

dialog.english: You're a big fan of coffee. Go easy on it.
It's not gonna kill you to have one.
dialog.korean: 한 잔 마신다고 큰일 나는 거 아니잖아.

dialog.english: Don't forget to bring Anna.
(Would you) care for dessert?
Yes, I'd like a cheese cake.
I always wear casual clothes.
It's not gonna kill you to look like a girl for one day.
dialog.korean: 하루 정도 여성스럽게 입는다고 큰일 나지 않아.

dialog.english: How do you like your coffee?
No cream. Please go easy on the sugar.
dialog.korean: 크림은 빼고 설탕은 조금만 넣어 주세요.

dialog.english: I'm sorry to keep you waiting. So where were we?
We need to fix the date for the next meeting?
When is the most convenient time for you?
Too bad I'm not able to make time this week.
dialog.korean: 안탑깝게도 이번 주는 시간을 낼 수가 없어요.

dialog.english: Try to look on a bright side.
Got it. Keep me posted on your progress.
dialog.korean: 알았어요. 진행 상황을 계속 알려 줘요.

dialog.english: Have you fixed the date for the wedding?
Yes. I've sent you the invitation. Please RSVP by Friday.
dialog.korean: 네. 초대장 보냈어요. 금요일까지 회답해 주세요.

dialog.english: Too bad you have to stay home on a day like this.
dialog.korean: 이런 날 집에 있어야 하다니 정말 안탑깝네요.

dialog.english: Tell me about it. I'll just vacuum the floor and wipe it.
dialog.korean: 내 말이요. 청소기 돌리고 바닥이나 닦아야죠.

dialog.english: I'm afraid I'm not really a people person.
Look on a bright side. You're the life of the party.
Ok, but I'm afraid my phone battery is dead.
dialog.korean: 네, 그런데 제 전화기 배터리가 나갔어요.

dialog.english: I'm calling to make a reservation at seven.
How many in your party, sir?
Do you have a room for six?
It makes no difference whether you book or not.
dialog.korean: 예약을 하시든 안 하시든 차이가 없어요.

dialog.english: What do you mean?
You'll be admitted on a first-come first-served basis.
I made a reservation in the name of Smith.
Ok, here it is. Your room number is 907.

contents.title: Can you give me a hand?

dialog.english: Can you give me a hand with this?
I'd love to, but I'm too busy.
How come you're good at making excuses?
dialog.korean: 넌 왜 그렇게 핑계를 잘 대니?

dialog.english: Don't take it out on me.
All you have to do is just say yes.
You have to do it yourself to improve your ability.
dialog.korean: 네 능력을 키우려면 스스로 해야 해.

dialog.english: I'm going camping this weekend. Want to com along?
dialog.korean: 이번 주말에 캠핑가려고 하는데. 같이 갈래요?

dialog.english: Why not? Can I get you anything?
Just bring yourself. I'll take care of everything.
dialog.korean: 그냥 몸만 오세요. 제가 다 알아서 준비할께요.

dialog.english: I've been wanting to hit the road for a change lately.
dialog.korean: 요즘 기분 전환 삼아 좀 떠나고 싶었어요.

dialog.english: That's great. I'm also looking forward to this trip.
dialog.korean: 잘됐네요. 저도 이번 여행을 고대하고 있어요.

dialog.english: I wouldn't miss it for anything.
Cross my heart. I wouldn't miss it for anything.
My boss is not easy to get along with.
dialog.korean: 우리 사장님과 함께 지내기 정말 힘들어.

dialog.english: What is it? Spit it out.
He's two-faced and getting out of hand.
dialog.korean: 그는 이중적이고 갈수록 감당히 안 돼.

dialog.english: You're annoyed by his constant complaints.
He's in a bad mood for some reason today.
dialog.korean: 오늘도 무슨 이유인지 기분이 안 좋으셔.

dialog.english: The thing is you're not cut out to kiss up him.
dialog.korean: 네가 아부에 소질이 없는 것도 문제야.

dialog.english: Nowadays children are getting out of hand.
dialog.korean: 요즘 애들은 정말 통제가 안 돼.

dialog.english: They always pick a fight when they run into each other.
You look like you are in a good mood today.
My son was discharged form the military yesterday.
I don't think I'm cut out to be a stay-home mom.
dialog.korean: 나한테 전업주부가 적성에 맞지 않나 봐.

dialog.english: I see what you mean. I think you should get a job.
Don't kiss up to me. It's not gonna work.
You're too much. Give me a break!
Please don't give me a hard time.
It's not like I asked you to marry me or what.
dialog.korean: 당신에세 결혼해 달라고 한 것도 아니잖아요.

dialog.english: You just occasionally wanna have coffee or lunch?
I hope we can get back together again.
dialog.korean: 우리가 다시 시작할 수 있기를 바래요.

dialog.english: How could you cheat on me for that long?
dialog.korean: 어떻게 그렇게 오래 바람을 피울 수가 있어요?

dialog.english: I must admit, I've crossed the line.
Really? How can you be so sure?
I'd like to put my car on the market.
Are you sure? What's the deal?
We don't need two cars anymore.
dialog.korean: 더 이상 자동차가 두 대나 필요 없잖아.

dialog.english: What if you have the car, and I have to go shopping?
dialog.korean: 당신이 차를 쓰고 있는데 내가 쇼핑을 가야하면요?

dialog.english: We need to cut back on shopping.
Honey, I think you should just calm down a little bit.
dialog.korean: 여보, 당신 잠시 진정해야 할 것 같아요.

dialog.english: From now on, we should cut back on spending.

contents.title: Don't tell me what to do.

dialog.english: I'm gonna have my friend over tonight.
What's the occasion? He's a friend from school?
Yes, the real good kind. We have a lot in common.
dialog.korean: 네. 정말 좋은 친구에요. 우린 공통점이 참 많아요.

dialog.english: You can't tell me something like this on such short notice.
dialog.korean: 그런 일을 그렇게 갑자기 애기하면 안 되지.

dialog.english: Mom, please don't tell me what to do.
dialog.korean: 엄마, 제발 잔소리 좀 하지 마세요.

dialog.english: He's not coming. Over my dead body.
dialog.korean: 친구는 못 와. 절대로 안 돼.

dialog.english: Why can't you do as you're told?
You're too nosy. Don't tell me what todo.
dialog.korean: 넌 간섭이 너무 심해. 잔소리 좀 하지 마.

dialog.english: I'm not feeling well today, so I called in sick.
dialog.korean: 오늘 몸이 안 좋아서 병가 냈어.

dialog.english: I think you should take a few days off.
dialog.korean: 너 며칠 쉬어야 할 것 같아.

dialog.english: I'd like to. Thanks for your concern.
dialog.korean: 그래야 할 것 같아. 걱정해 줘서 고마워.

dialog.english: It's like you've been working 24/7 these days.
dialog.korean: 요즘 밤낮으로 일만 하는 거 같더라.

dialog.english: I don't want to work overtime, but it's the only way.
dialog.korean: 나도 야근하고 싶지 않은데, 방법이 이거 밖에 없어.

dialog.english: I'm telling you, nobody can stop you.
I'm not feeling well. I can't shake off my cold.
dialog.korean: 몸이 좋지 않네. 감기가 떨어지질 않아.

dialog.english: Hey, what's up with your hair?
I overslept. My office dinner ended after midnight.
dialog.korean: 늦잠 잤어. 사무실 회식이 자정 넘어서 끝났거든.

dialog.english: You're supposed to make a presentation tomorrow.
dialog.korean: 너 내일 프레젠테이션 하기로 되어 있잖아.

dialog.english: Can you help me with my work a little?
Okay. Let's go over your assignment first.
dialog.korean: 그래. 먼저 네 과제물부터 검토해 보자.

dialog.english: Please book a meeting room first.
dialog.korean: 우선 회의실 부터 미리 예약해 줘.

dialog.english: I think we were supposed to get back together.
dialog.korean: 우리 다시 시작하기로 했던 것 같은데요.

dialog.english: I don't think we should see each other anymore.
What are you gonna do this weekend?
I'll take my kids outside and play in the yard.
dialog.korean: 애들 야외에 데리고 가서 뛰어 놀려고.

dialog.english: Why don't we go catch a late-night movie tomorrow?
Sounds good, but I'm signing up for yoga class.
dialog.korean: 좋은 생각인데, 요가 수강신청하러 가야 해.

dialog.english: Once you make a decision, you stick to it.
The clock is ticking. It's now or never.
dialog.korean: 시간이 흐르잖아. 지금 아니면 기회가 없어.

dialog.english: How do you keep in shape?
I stick to my diet and exercise a lot.
dialog.korean: 다이어트를 꾸준히 하고 운동을 많이 해요.

dialog.english: I got a flat tier while dropping off my son at school.
dialog.korean: 아들 학교 데려다주다 타이어에 펑크가 났어.

dialog.english: Again? It happened two months ago.
Yeah, and now my car won't start. This is ridiculous.
dialog.korean: 응, 게다가 차 시동도 안 걸려. 말도 안 돼.

dialog.english: Maybe you should call your insurance company.
I'm going to be a little late to work.
OK. I'll tell your immediate supervisor.
That's my final price. Take it or leave it.
This is ridiculous. It's way too expensive.
It seems I drink like a fish these days.
dialog.korean: 요즘 술을 너무 많이 마시는 것 같아.

dialog.english: Maybe you should go easy on the drinks.
dialog.korean: 술 좀 적당히 마시는 게 좋을 것 같아.

dialog.english: It's hard to reach you by phone.
Sorry. I haven't had time to return calls.
Do you remember we're going for a drink tonight?
dialog.korean: 오늘 저녁 술 약속한 거 기억하지?

dialog.english: Yes, but can I take a rain check?
dialog.korean: 그래. 그런데 다음 기회로 미루면 안 될까?

dialog.english: You can't break our promise this time.
I'm booked solid today. My head's gonna explode.
dialog.korean: 오늘 스케줄이 꽉 찼어. 머리가 터질 것 같아.

dialog.english: How can I reach you?
You can contact me by email or phone.
This is Mr. Kim returning your call.
Oh, yes. I've been expecting your call.
What about coming over for dinner this evening?
dialog.korean: 오늘 저녁 먹으러 우리 집에 올래?

dialog.english: Thanks for inviting me, but can I take a rain check?
dialog.korean: 초대해 줘서 고맙지만 다음에 하면 안 될까?

dialog.english: I'd like to book a room from July 23rd through 25th.
Could you come here a sec?
Speak of the devil,  what's up?
dialog.korean: 호랑이도 제 말하면 온다더니, 무슨 일이야?

dialog.english: Your boss is asking for the report.
One moment. I'll sneak out of the meeting.
Look, it's almost 6. Time to call it a day.
Okay. I'll wrap things up in 5 minutes.
My father passed away last night.
I've been working for 8 straight hours.
Let's call it a day and go grab a bite.
dialog.korean: 오늘은 그만하고 뭐 좀 먹으러 가자.

dialog.english: It's like you worry about the kids too much.
dialog.korean: 당신은 애들을 너무 걱정하는 것 같아.

dialog.english: Don't be silly. There is a good reason for that.
dialog.korean: 바보 같은 소리 마요. 그럴만한 이유가 있어요.

dialog.english: When I was their age, I used to disappear for hours.
dialog.korean: 내가 저 나이 땐 몇 시간씩 사라지곤 했어.

dialog.english: Times have changed. We can't take out eyes off them.
dialog.korean: 세상이 변했어요. 애들한테서 눈을 떼면 안 돼요.

dialog.english: Okay, I'll pay more attention.
Your room is a mess. Please help me clean it.
dialog.korean: 당신 방이 엉망이에요. 청소하는 것 좀 도와줘요.

dialog.english: That's not what we ordered.
Don't worry about it. It's on the house.
Have you ever committed any crimes?
Absolutely not. I've never broken the law.
dialog.korean: 물론 없죠. 법을 어겨 본 적도 없어요.

dialog.english: What if someone blackmails you into something?
In that case, I'll report to the police.
Actually, I'm in a sticky situation.
Not to worry. I'll keep an eye on you.
That guy blackmailed me into doing it.
dialog.korean: 저 남자가 나에세 그 일을 하라고 협박했어요.

dialog.english: Get a lawyer, or you could get in trouble.
dialog.korean: 변호사를 구하세요. 그렇지 않으면 곤란해질 수 있어요.

dialog.english: Your son is in critical condition.
We need to keep a close eye on him.
Let's go for a drive after the movie.
Sure. What movies are playing now?
dialog.korean: 좋아. 지금 무슨 영화가 상영 중인데?

dialog.english: Have you seen Interview by any chance?
I thought it would be good but was taken in by the ad.
You're not allowed to tell me the story.
Got it. Hurry up, or we'll be late.
How come you believed him?
I was taken in by his smooth manners.
Hurry up, or you'll miss the flight.
Relax. There's no rush.
I want to see if she wants to come back.
dialog.korean: 그녀가 돌아오고 싶어 하는지 알고 싶어.

dialog.english: After splitting up, it's good to go your separate ways.
dialog.korean: 헤이진 후엔 각자 길을 가는 게 좋아.

dialog.english: Should I give back things she got me?
dialog.korean: 걔가 나한테 준 물건을 돌려줘야 하나?

dialog.english: Just throw them away. What's the point of keeping them?
I have no idea how I can get over her.
dialog.korean: 그녀를 어떻게 잊을 수 있을지 모르겠어.

dialog.english: I'll set you up with a nice girl from my class.
dialog.korean: 우리 반에 있는 멋진 여자를 소개시켜 줄게.

dialog.english: Are you sure this is what you want to do?
Don't you get it? I have made that clear.
dialog.korean: 이해 안 돼요? 난 분명히 말했어요.

dialog.english: I hate to say this, but you're dead wrong.
dialog.korean: 이런 말하기 싫지만, 당신이 완전히 틀렸어요.

dialog.english: If you don't trust me, count me out.
dialog.korean: 날 믿지 못할 거라면 날 빼 주세요.

dialog.english: Oh, no. Here we go again.
What I want you to do is take some action.
dialog.korean: 내가 원하는 건 뭐든 조치를 취하는 거에요.

dialog.english: I made it clear that I objected.
No one understood what you were saying.
I owe you an apology. I forgot your birthday.
dialog.korean: 사과할 게 있어. 네 생일을 깜빡했어.

dialog.english: Come on, Let it go.
dialog.korean: 뭐 그런 걸 다. 신경 쓰지 마.

dialog.english: I promise it'll never happen again.
No problem. It could happen to anyone.
I want to make up for missing it.
dialog.korean: 네 기념을 놓친 걸 보상하고 싶어.

dialog.english: Forget it. I don't want to twist your arm.
I totally messed up my essay questions.
But you can make up for it in the final exam.
I'm not going to the party. Stop twisting my arm.
dialog.korean: 나 파티에 안 갈 거야. 그만 강요해.

dialog.english: Just make an excuse and leave early.
Why are you in a hurry? Just slow down.
dialog.korean: 왜 이렇게 서둘러요? 천천히 좀 해요.

dialog.english: I can't wait to get married and live with you.
Only because we go out doesn't mean we have to get married.
dialog.korean: 사귄다고 해서 결혼해야 하는 건 아니잖아요.

dialog.english: I see what you mean. Take whatever time you need.
dialog.korean: 무슨 말인지 알아요. 시간을 충분히 가져요.

dialog.english: Now you're talking.
People say that we are a good match.
Just because you're rich doesn't mean you can waste your money.
dialog.korean: 부자라고 해서 돈을 낭비해도 된다는 것은 아니야.

dialog.english: Right. Money doesn't grow on trees.
dialog.korean: 그래요. 돈이 쉽게 생기는 게 아니죠.

dialog.english: Can I borrow one of these books?
Sure, take whatever you want.
